wikipedia_page.main:
Raymond Digman (14 November 1934 – March 2009) is an English former cricketer. He was a right-handed batsman and right-arm medium-fast bowler who played for Cheshire. He was born in Liverpool.
Digman represented Cheshire in the Minor Counties Championship between 1955 and 1972, and in 1970 joined Sefton Cricket Club. Digman made two List A appearances for the team, though he scored a duck in each innings in which he played.

response: *Ray Digman, one of the finest fast-medium bowlers the Liverpool Competition has produced, joined Sefton as his first club and made his 1st XI debut in 1950.Miscellaneous Matches played by Raymond Digman. CricketArchive. Retrieved 12 December 2014.  He returned to the club in 1970 and was a key member of the club's 1972 title-winning side.  He represented Cheshire in the Minor Counties Championship from 1955 to 1972.  A long-standing secretary and later vice-president of the L&DCC, the Competition's 1st XI Knockout Trophy is now named in his honour.
